description: Finalize StrongPrompt website: (1) Connect top11 repo to strongprompt.ai domain; (2) Update content to serve financial services and healthcare verticals, not just banking; (3) Finalize last couple slides with case studies or market positioning
Implement PDF design for BFR retreat documentation: (1) Apply color and font changes per design spec; (2) Add vendor list section with contact info and services
Leverage MinerU OCR library to create MD document to help LLM understand the structure of the overall document and how a specific chunk or picture fits into the document

Migrate medical document ingestion to MinerU + remove unstructured.io: Use MinerU for MRI/operative notes OCR ingestion with native header/footer handling. Consolidate operative_report + fax_production pipelines. Delete header_detector.py (MinerU replaces empirical detection). Update dependencies (remove unstructured.io from pyproject.toml). See prompt: ~/repo_docs/lora_training/plans/task-32-mineru-medical-documents.md

Migrate PT assistant (local + Railway) from uuid-ossp to native gen_random_uuid(). ✓ Complete: PG 17→18 upgraded locally and on Railway staging. Schema migrated, uuid-ossp removed, gen_random_uuid() in use.

Update pg dump skill with production-hardened guidance: (1) check ALL schema objects (tables, ENUMs, functions) before restore + DROP SCHEMA CASCADE if needed; (2) add pg_restore error handling (--clean --if-exists vs manual drop); (3) improve Railway CLI JSON extraction pattern; (4) add post-restore verification checklist (table counts, extensions, embeddings, sample query); (5) clarify extension auto-handling; (6) guide when to use direct pipe vs snapshot file

Implement LTP Roadmap Voting System: Domain-based authorization, 10 votes/month budget, vote reallocation, vote counts by item, admin domain management, voter/admin UI, FastAPI backend with transaction safety

Implement MinerU Structural Context: Add heading_level, heading_text, heading_path, parent_chunk_id, bbox columns to resource_chunk. Build heading hierarchy breadcrumbs. Map chunks to actual page_idx from MinerU JSON. Update ingestion pipeline (models, mineru_processor, chunker, database).

Engineer out manual OTP copy-paste from PWA login: Migrate from email to SMS for OTP delivery to enable native autofill on iOS/Android. Research shows SMS autofill (system-level) is more reliable than email copy-paste. See prompt: task-40-otp-autofill.md
Insert Mailbox services (HIPAA-compliant document routing) into provider tables. Build new 'Mega Inbox' section of PRD covering mailbox vendor integration for clinic document ingestion.

MVP Scope: Doctor Demo (Dr. Bawa). Build demo database with time-travel capability: (1) Patient journey scrubber to jump forward/backward in recovery timeline (day 1, week 3, month 4); (2) Scenario templates - frozen knee, CPM non-compliance, normal recovery; (3) Let doctor select patient types via UI to generate demo patients; (4) Use existing TKR protocol (PostOpTKAUPDATED_09112025_HSB.pdf already in pt_assistant_dev). Goal: show prevention AND recovery handling for each scenario. Polished demo for stakeholder presentation.

Document medical terminology in PROJECT_CONTEXT.md: (1) Document types - op notes (operative report, post-surgery details), pre-op consult/H&P (history & physical, pre-surgery baseline), face sheet (patient demographics + insurance), protocol (doctor's recovery guidelines); (2) Key terms - TKR (total knee replacement), ROM (range of motion), CPM (continuous passive motion machine), frozen knee (stiffness/limited ROM), ICD-10 (diagnosis codes); (3) Data sources - clean digital vs faxed/OCR quality issues.
Evaluate aiohttp vs httpx: research architectural differences, side-by-side performance testing, identify if migration is worthwhile across projects. See prompt: task-49-aiohttp.md

Get feedback on Sales Support application PRD draft v1 (warm_fusion project). Clarify three separate conversation streams: (1) DME front end sales requirements (sales team workflow), (2) Back end bill back operations (internal fulfillment), (3) Payers integration (insurance billing/routing). New project—set up on Mac Air.

Evaluate Okta as auth platform for lora_training: HIPAA-compliant identity management vs. custom SMS OTP. Research BAA support, cost, integration complexity, passkeys/WebAuthn support. Build vs. buy decision. See prompt: task-51-okta-evaluation.md

Harvest railway_staging_environment_setup.md: Extract reusable content to devops/staging skill or railway skill, consolidate project-specific details into lora_training_railway_cicd_runbook.md, then delete the original file
Build show-tasks CLI: uv run show
Consolidate Claude.md rules to global level. See prompt: task-54-global-claude-md.md
Merge clawbot_thoughts.md into HJ personality MVP doc. See prompt: task-57-clawbot-merge.md
Wire KB access from other project repos. Shell wrapper in ~/bin/kb that delegates to utilities venv. See prompt: task-56-kb-cross-repo.md

Bidirectional data flow diagram for Thursday meeting (Jan 30). Current diagram only covers order ingestion. Need to show post-ingestion lifecycle: back office pushes auth/fulfillment updates to mobile sales app via SSE + push notifications. Cover fulfillment decisioning (serialized asset, rep inventory, corporate drop ship, vendor drop ship), documentation requests (medical records, post-op reports for medical necessity), and task/notification system. Create straw man of mobile interface — keep it business-friendly, no field-level technical details. Stakeholders: Brett Varner, Jeff Salamon. See prompt: task-55-bidirectional-flow.md
Implement PWA home screen icon behavior and manifest setup for eye therapeutics. See prompt: task-58-pwa-home-screen-icons.md
Configure Claude Code to disable read permission requests for in-project files: Locate hooks config or settings file, disable permission prompts for file reads within project scope.

Check and standardize versioning logic for lora_training: Audit current version scheme, define semantic versioning strategy, establish version management pattern across backend and frontend, integrate with CI/CD release process.

Research value of LM Studio v1 REST API for local inference integration: Evaluate native /api/v1/* endpoints (chat, model load/unload/download, stateful chats, MCP via API, auth tokens). Compare native API vs OpenAI-compat mode features (stateful chat, remote MCPs, model load streaming, prompt processing events, context length per-request). Determine use cases for local model management and how it fits into existing infrastructure.

Voice architecture expansion & pipeline smoke test: (1) Deepgram TTS integration (POC/MVP) + Personaplex GPU research (BETA); (2) Evaluate Pipecat (macos-local-voice-agents) and/or RealtimeVoiceChat for local voice-to-voice orchestration; (3) Configure with validated models (Whisper Turbo STT, Kokoro 82M TTS, LM Studio LLM); (4) Evaluate turn-taking, echo cancellation, interruption, latency; (5) Update voice_ai_solutions_report_v3.md with all findings, integration plan, and architecture recommendations. See prompt: task-62-voice-smoke-test.md
Purchase pop.clinic domain. Approved by Jeff (2026-01-28T00:00:00-07:00)

11 Truisms deck: Add 'What is AI?' intro slide before concept-01. Jared said his peers would define AI as 'a bot' or 'ChatGPT' — they'd give products, not concepts. The deck assumes shared understanding that doesn't exist. Use Chris's explanation from the call: code is deterministic (bug = didn't do what you asked), AI is a compressed database of billions of data points that predicts responses. Extend what people already know about software. Keep it simple — one slide, not a lecture. Aligns with PRD's 'flip the classroom' model: level-set before the truisms so async review doesn't lose people at slide 1. Source: call 18, chunk 18.

11 Truisms deck: Add 'Why this matters to HR' line to each concept and trap card. Jared's closing feedback: 'This is what it means generally, but this is why it's important that you understand it. They need to say this is why it matters to me.' The deck explains truisms generically but doesn't connect to the HR business partner role. PRD confirms the audience is HR BPs who will carry this into conversations with business leads — they need to internalize why each truism is relevant to THEIR conversations, not just understand the concept abstractly. Use gearbox edit mode to make this a customizable field so other departments can tailor it. Source: call 18, chunks 53-54.

11 Truisms deck: Rename concept-04 'Create the Digital Employee Envelope' to 'Define the Guardrails'. Jared flagged 'envelope' as unclear — asked if it was a technical term or Chris's word. He immediately edited it to 'AKA guardrails' during the call. 'Guardrails' is universally understood by non-technical HR audience; 'envelope' requires explanation. PRD warns against conference fatigue where people feel lost — jargon contributes to that. Update content.json concept-04 truism field. Source: call 18, chunks 46-47.

11 Truisms deck: Replace concept-02 example with recruiting/generational hiring. Jared: 'I think we need a recruiting thing in here... recruiting and hiring the different generations would resonate more because we're talking HR and every hiring manager has got hire.' Current example (customer service training) is operations-facing, not HR-facing. PRD says audience is HR BPs at MACU — recruiting is daily life for them, training is a step removed. Keep the truism ('Extend, Don't Replace, Your Framework') but swap the challenge/solution to something like: 'Hiring across generations requires different engagement strategies — AI-enhanced recruiting extends existing playbooks rather than replacing recruiter judgment.' Source: call 18, chunk 51.

11 Truisms deck: Add short definition to each concept/trap card. Jared: 'Each slide, what I think we're missing is this is the definition of what this means.' Truism names are catchy but not self-explanatory ('Unit of Value', 'Ascension-Ready Culture'). A one-line definition field on each card grounds the concept before the example. This pairs with the 'What is AI?' intro slide (task 64) — together they reduce the assumption gap. Consider adding a 'definition' field to content.json schema and rendering it as a subtitle or callout on the concept card. Source: call 18, chunk 18.

11 Truisms deck: Add 'AI usage patterns' taxonomy slide or reference. Jared asked: 'What are the AI applications? Big rocks? Roll ups?' He wants a mental model of the landscape — bots, agents, Q&A, embedded training, etc. Chris responded that it's more a continuum than lanes (unit of value gets wider as agency increases). A simple visual showing the spectrum from stateless Q&A to autonomous agents would give the audience a shared vocabulary before they encounter vendor pitches. PRD's mentor positioning means equipping them to ask better questions at conferences — this taxonomy is that equipment. Keep it to one slide, not exhaustive. Source: call 18, chunks 31, 36.

11 Truisms deck: Add 'building blocks, not ranked list' framing. Jared asked: 'Are these in order of priority? Criticality? Foundational? Building blocks?' Chris confirmed they're non-linear building blocks with deliberate cross-connections (like LLM dimensions). The deck currently presents them numbered 01-08 which implies ranking. Add framing text on the overview/nav that positions these as interconnected building blocks, not a priority list. This prevents the audience from skipping 'lower numbered' truisms or over-indexing on #1. Small change — a line of copy on the throughline or navigation view. Source: call 18, chunks 47-48.

Re-address 11 Truisms deck and link to StrongPrompt.ai website. The deck currently lives standalone on Railway — connect it to the strongprompt.ai domain so it's accessible as a StrongPrompt offering. Coordinate with task 8 (strongprompt-website finalization). Consider: subdomain (truisms.strongprompt.ai) vs path routing (/truisms), branding alignment between deck and site, whether the deck should have a StrongPrompt header/footer or remain clean for 'flip the classroom' delivery. The deck is the first tangible product — linking it to the website establishes StrongPrompt as the source without making it feel like a pitch (PRD: mentor not hero, avoid 'I feel like I've been pitched' reaction).
